{
 "cells": [
  {
   "cell_type": "markdown",
   "id": "abb0b5e6",
   "metadata": {},
   "source": [
    "# Tutorial for the HN module of HavNegpy package"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 1,
   "id": "419f647e",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import numpy as np\n",
    "import pandas as pd\n",
    "import matplotlib.pyplot as plt\n",
    "import os\n",
    "import HavNegpy as dd\n",
    "%matplotlib qt\n",
    "os.chdir(r'M:\\Marshall_Data\\mohamed_data\\mohamed_data\\n44')"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 2,
   "id": "6b9e2def",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "def create_dataframe(f):\n",
    "        col_names = ['Freq', 'T', 'Eps1', 'Eps2']\n",
    "        #f = input(str(\"Enter the filename:\"))\n",
    "        df = pd.read_csv(f, sep=r\"\\s+\",index_col=False,usecols = [0,1,2,3],names=col_names,header=None,skiprows=4,encoding='unicode_escape',engine='python')\n",
    "        col1 = ['log f']    \n",
    "        for start in range(0, len(df), 63):\n",
    "           name = df['T'][start]\n",
    "           #print(name)\n",
    "           col1.append(name)\n",
    "        df2 = pd.DataFrame()   \n",
    "        f1 = df['Freq'][0:63].values\n",
    "        x1 = np.log10((f1))\n",
    "        e = pd.DataFrame(x1)\n",
    "        df2['log f'] = pd.concat([e],axis=1,ignore_index=True)\n",
    "        global Cooling,Heating\n",
    "        for start in range(0, len(df), 63):\n",
    "        \n",
    "            \n",
    "            f = df['Eps2'][start:start+63].values\n",
    "            ep = np.log10(f)\n",
    "            d = pd.DataFrame(ep)\n",
    "         \n",
    "           \n",
    "            \n",
    "            df2[start] = pd.concat([d],axis=1,ignore_index=True)\n",
    "            \n",
    "        df2.columns = col1\n",
    "        '''\n",
    "        a = int(len(col1)/3)\n",
    "        b = 2*a\n",
    "        c = int(len(col1)) - b\n",
    "    \n",
    "        Heating1 = df2.iloc[8:,0:a+1]\n",
    "        Cooling = df2.iloc[8:,a+1:b+1]\n",
    "        Heating2 = df2.iloc[8:,b+1:]\n",
    "        \n",
    "        heat1_col = col1[0:a+1]\n",
    "        cool_col = col1[a+1:b+1]\n",
    "        heat2_col = col1[b+1:]\n",
    "        Cooling.columns = cool_col\n",
    "        Heating1.columns = heat1_col\n",
    "        Heating2.columns = heat2_col\n",
    "        \n",
    "        f2 = df['Freq'][8:59].values\n",
    "        x2 = np.log10((f2))\n",
    "        \n",
    "        Cooling['Freq'] = x2\n",
    "        Heating1['Freq'] = x2\n",
    "        Heating2['Freq'] = x2\n",
    "        '''   \n",
    "        Cooling = df2.iloc[:,0:25]\n",
    "        Heating = df2.iloc[:,25:]\n",
    "        return df,df2,Cooling,Heating #Heating2"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "id": "0da19910",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "df,df2,cool,heat = create_dataframe('EPS.TXT')"
   ]
  },

   ]

     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "plt.figure()\n",
    "plt.scatter(x,y,label='data for fitting')\n",
    "plt.xlabel('log f [Hz]')\n",
    "plt.ylabel('log $\\epsilon$\"')\n",
    "plt.legend()\n",
    "plt.title('Example for HN fitting')"
   ]

   "source": [
    "''' select range to perform hn fitting'''\n",
    "''' the select range functions pops in a separate window and allows you two clicks to select the region of interest (ROI)'''\n",
    "''' In this tutorial, I'll plot the ROI and append as an image in the next cell'''\n",
    "\n",
    "x1,y1 = hn.select_range(x,y)"
   ]
  },

      "enter the beta value:0.5\n",
      "enter the gamma value:1\n",
      "enter the fm:3.75\n",
      "enter the deps:0.5\n",
      "enter the cond:0\n",
      "enter the s:1\n",
      "dumped_parameters {'beta': 0.5, 'gamma': 1.0, 'freq': 5623.413251903491, 'deps': 0.5, 'cond': 0.0, 'n': 1.0}\n"
     ]
    },
    {
     "data": {
      "text/plain": [
       "()"
      ]
     },
     "execution_count": 24,
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "execute_result"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "''' dump the initial guess parameters using dump parameters method (varies for each fn), which dumps the parameters in a json file'''\n",
    "''' this is required before performing the first fitting as it takes the initial guess from the json file created'''\n",
    "hn.dump_parameters_hn()\n"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 25,
   "id": "1ddeac90",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "name": "stdout",
     "output_type": "stream",

     ]
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "''' view the initial guess for the ROI using initial_view method'''\n",
    "''' I'll append the image in the next cell'''\n",
